Row.Text: King Foltest was the ruler of Temeria, prince of Sodden, sovereign of Pontaria and Mahakam as well as the senior protector of Brugge and Ellander. He was the son of King Medell and Queen Sancia of Sodden.
+5 [ICON_Strength] when fighting in Forest or Jungle.

Emhyr var Emreis was the Imperator of the Nilfgaardian Empire. His rule of Nilfgaard was highly aggressive, often pursuing expansionist policies similar to those of his predecessors. This led to the outbreak of two wars against the North.Emhyr var Emreis was an intelligent and brilliant ruler. He chose his people well and crushed all plots against him. He was ruthless toward traitors and moved towards his goals with great determination.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in your territory or adjacent to your territory.

Sigismund Dijkstra is the head of Redanian Intelligence, or secret service. During the Second Nilfgaard War, King Vizimir of Redania was assassinated. During the interregnum, the country was ruled by a Regency Council headed by Dijkstra and Philippa Eilhart. This made him basically the most powerful man in the kingdom.

Radovid V the Stern is the King of Redania.He bears a deep hatred of mages. His father Vizimir II the Just was secretly assassinated during Radovid's infancy probably by the sorceress advisor Philippa Eilhart, who then assumed the regency in his name, and dominated and demeaned him throughout his youth.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one Redanian Footsoldier adjacent.

King Henselt, King of Kaedwen, heir to the Dynasty of the Unicorn. For many years, he engaged in an ongoing dispute with King Demavend III of Aedirn over the Lormark. Henselt was also the architect of a plan to exterminate all non-humans in areas bound by the Pontar, Gwenllech and Buina rivers.
Can can move after attacking and move over Hills faster.
Crach an Craite, after the death of his uncle Eist Tuirseach, who had inherited the throne of King Bran, Crach became the Jarl and thus the ruler of the Skellige Islands.
Yields 60% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] as [ICON_Gold] on combat victory.
King Demavend III was the ruler of Aedirn. As a ruler he was known for being rather cruel and envious, but also quite intelligent and knowledgeable about the tactics of war.
+4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting civilizations that follow other Religions.

Meve is the queen of Lyria and Rivia. She was known for her wisdom and beauty, but a later battle left her face bearing wounds that became disfiguring scars. She was the one who knighted Geralt for his valour in the same battle and granted him the right to be known as Geralt of Rivia.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. melee and ranged units.

Enid an Gleanna, also known as Francesca Findabair, is an elf, a sorceress and the queen of the elves of Dol Blathanna as decreed by the Imperator Emhyr var Emreis. She is also a founding member of the Lodge of Sorceresses.
Can move and see through Woods and Rainforest.Cannot be seen in the woods or jungle unless they are adjacent to it.
Can move and see through Woods and Rainforest.Cannot be seen in the woods or jungle unless they are adjacent to it.
Can move and see through Woods and Rainforest.Cannot be seen in the woods or jungle unless they are adjacent to it.

Esterad Thyssen was the king of Kovir, Poviss, Narok, Velhad and Talgar during the second war with Nilfgaard. He was the son of Baldwin and Blanka of Malleore. Although Kovir was officially neutral, Esterad helped the Northern forces by granting royal pardon to the prisoners in his kingdom, many of which later formed the Free Company led by "Adieu" Pangratt.

Morvran Voorhis was an Imperator of the Nilfgaardian Empire from the Voorhis family who ascended the throne sometime around the end of the 13th century. As a relative of Emhyr var Emreis through both paternal and maternal lines, his position was always secured.

Jan Calveit was Emperor of Nilfgaard, succeeding Morvran Voorhis. He was aware of Emhyr's mistakes and tried to not repeat them. He was also apparently forgiving and able to give second chances. Emperor Jan Calveit had broad intellectual horizons. He dabbled in a variety of scholarly disciplines; medicine and astrology in particular. His critics complained at his hobbies' lack of practical application, until the time came to prove how very wrong they were.

Bran Tuirseach was a monarch of Skellige, the maternal uncle of Crach an Craite and the brother of Eist Tuirseach, with whom he had a friendly relationship and who led his army as Jarl of Skellige. Other than his brother, the king had a good friend and confidante in druid Mousesack.

Harald an Craite, a member of the an Craite clan. As a warrior, Harald was thoroughly unremarkable. Then a bear mangled his leg and the bone healed back crooked. After that, each step caused him agonizing pain... and he fought better than ever before. He claimed the grit of constant suffering had honed an unstoppable edge.

Eithné is the queen of the dryads and ruler of Brokilon. She is famous for her wisdom and implacable stance towards humans. Their attempts to claim the ancient forest for its trees and supposed treasures have fostered centuries of conflict.d
Other civilizations' [ICON_TRADEROUTE] Trade Routes to you provide +1 Faith [ICON_FAITH] and +1 Gold [ICON_Gold] for you.
-50% war weariness from combat in your territory.
Other civilizations' [ICON_TRADEROUTE] Trade Routes to you provide +2 Faith [ICON_FAITH].
+20% Production toward Ranged Naval units from all the eras since the Classical Era.
+1 Gold [ICON_Gold] for all districts next to the Coast.
+1 Gold [ICON_Gold] in the Encampment next to a River.

Receive the [ICON_RESOURCE_WINE] Wine. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold from [ICON_RESOURCE_WINE] Wine, [ICON_RESOURCE_INCENSE] Incense, [ICON_RESOURCE_COCOA] Cocoa, [ICON_RESOURCE_TOBACCO] Tobacco, [ICON_RESOURCE_COFFEE] Coffee, and [ICON_RESOURCE_TEA] Tea Plantations.
+2 Culture [ICON_Culture] for all districts next to the Coast.
Your [ICON_TRADEROUTE] Trade Routes to any City-State provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every specialty district in the origin city.
Your [ICON_TradingPost] Trading Posts in foreign cities provide +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes passing through.
Holy Sites gains +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for Forest adjacency.
Commercial Hubs gains 1 [ICON_Gold] Gold if they are next to a Mountain.
Teather districts gains 1 [ICON_Culture] Culture if they are next to a Mountain.

Your districts provide +1 [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person point of their type ([ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer, [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist, and [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician for Theater Square districts).
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to foreign cities earn +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for each Luxury resource at the destination.
Your cities have full [ICON_Housing] Housing from water, as if they were all next to a River.
Your light and heavy cavalry units have +5 [ICON_Strength] Strength when fighting on hill tiles.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production for all districts next to the Coast.
Your Bonus resources behave like Luxury resources, providing 1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity per type.
Your Encampment districts provide +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity each.
+50% Production toward anti-cavalry units from all the eras.
Industrial Zone districts gains 1 [ICON_Production] Production if they are next to a Mountain.
All Fishing Boats gain +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold. Receive the [ICON_RESOURCE_PEARLS] Pearls.
Industrial Zone districts gains 1 [ICON_Production] Production if they are next to Plains.
Regional effects from your Industrial Zone and Entertainment Complex districts reach 3 tiles farther.
Automatically converts to the Religion you founded, and exerts pressure for that Religion as if it were a Holy City.
+1 Faith [ICON_Faith] in the Holy Sites next to a River.
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to any city-state provide +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every specialty district in the origin city.
When you enter a new era, earn 1 random [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka from that era.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking and -7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one Trebuchet adjacent.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. melee and ranged units.
Half of the attack of the Crossbowman, but can attack twice per turn.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending in Woods, Jungle, Hills, or Marsh.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in or adjacent to its home territory.
Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. melee and ranged units.
Heals at the end of every turn, even after moving or attacking.
Three tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +2 [ICON_Food] Food, +1 [ICON_Science] Science and +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to adjacent tiles.
Mount Gorgon, also known as "Devil Mountain" is the highest peak in the Amell range most of time covered by fog. The elven cemetery of Tir ná Béa Arainne is found in a cave there.
Three tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +2 [ICON_Production] Production, +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to adjacent tiles.

Located in the mountains of Mahakamm, Mahakamm is famous for its weapons, forged using advanced gnomish technology in workshops which are reported to lie deep in its depths. Many mines, foundries and forges are located there. Iron from Mount Carbon is famous for its quality and is considered to be the best in the world.
Three tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture to adjacent tiles.
The Great Kestrel is one of the three tallest peaks in the Kestrel Mountains, a range which separates Kaedwen from Redania, Kovir and Poviss.
Three tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to adjacent tiles

Kaer Trolde mountain is the highest peak in the archipelago above the Kaer Trolde. According to legend, Grymmdjarr, first lord of Ard Skellig, dove into the depths of the sea and used the thickest chain his father, Hemdall, could forge to drag an enormous rock to the surface, placing it on Ard Skellig's north-eastern shore. This enormous rock was the mountain that Grymmdjarr carved Kaer Trolde out of with his bare hands, and where it stands to this day, the pride and glory of his clan, Clan an Craite.
Two tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +4 [ICON_Science] Science.
Tarn Mira, or Bottomless Lake is a clover-shaped lake in Mil Tracta on the north shore of which rises Tor Zireael. The banks are very steep and it is surrounded by a dark forest.
Four tile natural wonder. It appears as Marsh and provides +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +1 [ICON_Science] Science and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Caed Dhu is a forest in Angren, on the bank of the Yaruga. In Elder Speech the phrase means Black Forest, or Black Grove.
Four tile natural wonder. It appears as Marsh and provides +1 [ICON_Science] Science and +4 [ICON_Food] Food.
The swamps of Pereplut in Ebbing. It is there that Vysogota of Corvo, the noted scholar, fled when he was pursued. He eventually created a hermitage there.
Two tile natural wonder that can be found on ocean terrain and provides +4 [ICON_Science] Science.

Sedna Abyss, also known as Sedna Trench, tends to be avoided by the islanders as ships disappear in this area due to unnatural causes. In particular, if entered, a maelstrom forms out of nowhere and the unlucky ship disappears.
